WHAAT ? Ruby recommended only once? :(

no, we use he as it is correct grammer , political correctness crap is what messed up some people's grammer that you see here some times. Too many American TV  series with hidden/semi-hidden political messages3
Only for web dev, is Ruby used anywhere else? :P
I like "political correctness", it makes me show off how cool I am :)
Paython every where :), this is not true

Tarek Amr T_T no.
oh, yes Metasploit :D
is there a higher resolution copy ?
نسخه pdf http://cdn3.carlcheo.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/which-programming-language-should-i-learn-first-pdf.pdf

Mohamed Samy that was the most misinformed comment I've seen so far this week. Congratulations, you just failed the Internet. You yourself could use some spell checking, a bit of grammar and a little less of conspiracy theories.

It's also worth mentioning that political correctness does not equate bad grammar. If anything, it indicates a certain level of social discipline so I applaud Tarek for that. 

Tarek Amr It's not a geeks thing, it's a commonly debated topic in English and there are no right answers to it.
The topic is gender-neutral pronouns in your specific case if you're interested in searching for it and gender-neutral English for the broader topic. For the language enthusiasts out there, you can dive even deeper by reading about grammatical gender.

The usage of she as a gender-specific pronoun is not grammatically incorrect.

It's an old inherited issue with English, displeasure for the usage of a male oriented pronoun has been expressed (both socially and legally) a lot in the past 20+ years enough for some linguists to call for the introduction of gender-neutral pronouns, but for what it's worth you could always use the singular 'they'.
That's common and it has been a consistent practice in English for decades.

When in doubt, use what you feel more comfortable with. English literature is littered with gender-specific and gender-neutral grammatical structures. Some authors even alternate the pronoun gender by paragraphs.

Hope that cleared any confusion you had and apologies Mohamed if my tone sounded condescending, if it did then it probably was and that's the Internet. Don't dish it out if you can't take it.
Oh, and thanks for the post :D
Hady Ahmad All I read is a long post with "Political correctness bla bla bla..."
Actually,, the old grammer books in English all spoke of the third person anonymous as a He not a She. The same as in Arabic.
معلش فى السؤال ، بس هو ايه ال political correctness بالصلاة عالنبى ؟ :-D
Hady Ahmad for you to sound condescending, I'd have to care :) ....

Emad Elsaid basically it's when you don't want to offend anyone or bother anyone so you go an extra mile to please them and then it ends up becoming a form of social hypocrisy. You know when on sitcoms they get 2 women marrying as lesbians, and the ex-husband of one of them is there at the wedding as "support" (e.g. friends) political correctness. When they talk that there is no diffrence between male and female and  they say men should stay at home and women work, political correctness. What bothers me about it is that it has gone so far as to change the classical grammer of a language. I found myself writing "s/he" all the time, to prove that I am not a "mysogynst" (another politically correct word). In the end, I found I have nothing to prove and neither do you. Unless you do something wrong or suspicious, you have a right to the benefit of teh doubt,
Emad Elsaid مش لاقيلها ترجمة بالعربي غير فزلكة

Tarek Amr what I am against is the changing of grammer or names of things. It is defintley not a good thing IMHO. But the fact remains that grammer is grammer,  I try to keep a space that is "PC free" :)

Mohamed Samy well, that or you'd have to have some self respect and a will to save face. Apparently you're lacking on both... Once more you've displayed an enormous amount of misplaced ego, still failed to present a single credible reference stating that using "she" is grammatically incorrect and generally just made a fool out of yourself.

Classical grammar? You surely must know that languages tend to evolve. Not to mention the fact that English never had a claim on a specific gender-specific pronoun being more correct than others or preferred for that matter.

At the very least, spare yourself any further embarrassment and for the love of god, correct "grammer". The word is spelled with an "A" not an "E", and it's "misogynist" not "mysogynst".

You're picking on someone's use of a language construct that you yourself fail to understand properly, not to mention fail to use the language properly. If you have an urge not to be inclusive while you address a group of people, that's on you, but if you plan on presenting an argument then do it right.
I blocked Hady so I wouldn't see his comments. Too rude, and nonsensical to waste time.
